info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued January 29 at 9:12AM EST by NWS New York City - Upton
info.description: ...HEAVY SNOW AND NEAR BLIZZARD TO BLIZZARD CONDITIONS ACROSS CENTRAL AND WESTERN LONG ISLAND...COASTAL CONNECTICUT BETWEEN NEW HAVEN AND THE MOUTH OF THE CONNECTICUT RIVER...AND EASTERN QUEENS IN NEW YORK CITY... Radar showed bands of heavy snow capable of producing snowfall of 1 to 2 inches per hour. The heavy snow, along with north winds gusting up to 45 mph, is producing near blizzard to blizzard conditions, with near zero visibility at times, considerable blowing and drifting of snow, and wind chills near zero. Travel is strongly discouraged! If you must travel, bring a winter survival kit. If you become stranded, stay with your vehicle.
